meanings.definition: The quality or state of being playful or mischievous.
meanings.sent1: Her larkiness brightened up the room with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent2: The children's larkiness during recess brought smiles to the teachers' faces.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's larkiness got him into trouble when he chased his tail into the mud.
meanings.sent4: His larkiness was like a burst of colorful confetti in the otherwise dull office environment.
meanings.sent5: The larkiness of the kitten was contagious, spreading happiness to everyone around.

meanings.definition: Behavior characterized by a sense of fun or mischief.
meanings.sent1: The group of friends' larkiness at the party made it a night to remember.
meanings.sent2: Despite their larkiness, they always knew when to be serious and focused.
meanings.sent3: The larkiness of the squirrel as it played in the garden amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her larkiness was a cloak of charm that she wore effortlessly in social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The larkiness of the class clown kept the students entertained during long lectures.
